result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian David Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution to Karlie Wiegel in the amount of $159.06.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not have any contact with Karlie Wiegel.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall participate in and successfully complete domestic violence treatment.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian David Watson

defendant.name: Watson, Brian David
defendant.address: 217 West Lafayette Street, Cuba City, WI 53807

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Check stub from DOC from check #P2433467 in the amount of $352.00

Case called at 2:34 PM.
Defendant Brian David Watson in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Schiro informs the court this matter is resolved and filed plea and waiver  form for the courts review.
Defendant withdrawals plea of "NOT GUILYT" and enter a plea of "GUILTY" to Counts 2 & 3.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Schiro re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 2 & 3 
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties
Attorney Schiro concurs with the state's request.
Court finds that there is a factual basis.
Defendant makes statement to the court.
Court grants motion of the parties 
Sentence withheld probation for a period of 18 months with conditions.
>AODA, No Contact with Wiegel, No alcohol  or establishments, domestic violence treatment, counseling, other rules, costs & restitution.
0 day's sentence credit if revoked.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Letter from Schiro & Zarzynski stating enclosure of Authorization to Appear
to appear for Schiro & Zarzynski to appear on behalf of Brian D. Watson
Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 3:05 PM.
Attorney John Scott Schiro appeared by phone means for Defendant Brian David Watson. Prosecuting Atty  Katherine Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian David Watson not in court.
Attorney Schiro infoms the court re: status of offer has been made and m-ves to contune for resolution.
No objection.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Letter with demand for discovery & affidavit of mailing

Case called at 1:59 PM.
Defendant Brian David Watson in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Attorney Schiro waives formal reading of the criminal complaint.
Attorney Schiro reserves the right to raise a challenge to Count 3.
Attorney Schiro enters a "NOT GUILTY" plea ALL Counts.
State requests $1,500.00 
-No contact with Carlie Wiegel.
Attorney Schiro to appear by phone.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Carlie Wiegel.
Cash bond of $850.00 received from John Hocking on 2-6-16
Letter with authorization to apear and notice of retainer.
Initial appearance on April 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
